<div><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:4.5pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:-14.4pt;' >1</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;' >.  Basis of Presentation</font></p><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:6pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;margin-left:0pt;' >The Company</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Americ</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >an Express Company</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > is a global services company that provides customers with access to products, insights and experiences that enrich lives and build</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > business success. Our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >principal products and services are charge and credit payment card products and travel-related services offered to consumers and businesses around the world. Business travel-related services are offered through the non-consolidated joint venture, American </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Express Global Business Tr</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >avel (the GBT JV). Our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > various products and services are sold globally to diverse customer groups, including consumers, small businesses, mid-sized companies and large corporations. These products and services are sold through var</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ious c</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >hannels, including mobile and </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >online applications, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >direct mail, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >in-ho</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >use sales teams, third-party vendors</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > and direct response advertising</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >The accompanying Consolidated Financial Statements should be read in conjunction with the Consolidated Financi</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >al Stat</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ements included in our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >2017</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > (the Annual Report). If not materially different, certain footnote disclosures included therein have been omitted from this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >The</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > interim consolidated financial information in this report has not been audited. In the opinion of management, all adjustments, which consist of normal recurring adjustments necessary for a fair statement of the interim period consolidated financial inform</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ation, have been made. Results of operations reported for interim periods are not necessarily indicative of results for the entire year.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:12pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >The preparation of Consolidated Financial Statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in th</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >e United States of America (GAAP) requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses, and the disclosures of contingent assets and liabilities. These accounting estimates ref</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >lect the best judgment of management, but actual results could differ.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:13.8pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:0pt;' >Discount Revenue </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Discount revenue primarily</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > represents the amount we earn on transactions occurring at merchants</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > that</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > have entered into a card acceptance agreement</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > with us,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > or a Global Network Services (GNS) partner or other third-party merchant acquirer,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > for facilitating transactions between the merchants and Card Members. The amount of fees charged, or merchant discount, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >varies with, among other factors, the industry in wh</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ich the merchant conducts business, the merchant&#8217;s overall transaction volume, the timing and method of payment to the merchant, the method of submission of transactions and, in certain instances, the geographic scope of the card acceptance agreement signe</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >d with us (e.g., local or global) and the transaction amount. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >The merchant discount is generally deducted from the payment to the merchant and recorded a</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >s discount revenue at the time the</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > Card Member transaction </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >occurs</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >The card acceptance agre</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ements, whic</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >h outline the agreed-</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >upon terms for charging the merchant discount fee, vary in duration. Our contracts with small- and medium-sized merchants generally have no fixed contractual duration, while those with large merchants are generally for fixed periods, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >w</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >hich typically range from three to seven years in duration. Our fixed-period agreements may</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > include auto-renewal features</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > which </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >may </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >allow the existing terms to continue beyond the stated expiration date until a new agreement is reached.  We satisfy our ob</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ligations under these agreements over the contract term, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >often </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >on a daily basis, through the processing of Card Member transactions and </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >availability of our payment network.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In cases where we are the card issuer and the merchant acquirer is a third part</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >y (which </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >is </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >the case</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >, for example, under our OptBlue program, or </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >with certain </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >of our GNS partners</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >), we receive a network rate </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >fee </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >in our settlement with the merchant acquirer, which is individually negotiated between us and that merchant acquirer and is re</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >corded as discount revenue at the time the</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > Card Member</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > transaction occurs. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >In our role as the operator of the American Express network, we also settle with merchants on behalf of our GNS card issuing partners, who in turn receive an issuer rate that is </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >individually negotiated between that issuer and us and is recorded as expense in Marketing and business development (see below) or as contra-revenue in </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >Other</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > revenue.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > In contrast with networks such as those o</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >perated by Visa Inc. and Masterc</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ard Incorporated</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >, there are no collectively set interchange rates</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > or network rates</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > on the American Express network, and no fees are agreed or due between the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >GNS partners</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > on the network.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:0pt;' >Net Card Fees </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Net card fees </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >represent revenue earned from annual card membership fee</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >s, which vary based on the type of card and the number of cards for each account. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >These fees, net of acquisition costs and a reserve for projected refunds </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >for Card Member cancellations, are deferred and recognized on a straight-line basis over the twelve-m</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >onth card membership period as Net Card Fees in the Consolidated Statements of Income. The unamortized net card fee balance is reported in Other Liabilities on the Consolidated Balance Sheets.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:0pt;' >Other Fees and Commissions </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Other fees and commissions includes</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >certain </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >fees charged to Card Members, including delinquency fees and foreign currency conversion fees, which are primarily recognized in the period in which they are charged to the</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > Card Member. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Other fees and commissions </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >also </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >includes </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Membership Rewards p</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >rogram fees, which </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >are deferred and recognized over the period covered</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > by the fee, typically one year, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >the unamortized portion of which is included in Other Liabilities on the Consolidated Balance Sheets. In addition, Other fees and commissions includes lo</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >y</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >alty coalition-related fees,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > travel commissions and fees</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > and</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > service fees earned from merchants</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > that are recognized when the service is performed, which is generally in the period the fee is charged. Refer to Note 13 for additional information.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:0pt;' >Contra-re</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;' >venue</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;margin-left:0pt;' >P</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ayments</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > made</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > through contractual arrangements with </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >our </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >merchants, GNS partners, and other customers</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >are classified as </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >expense where</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > we receive goods</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > services or other benefits</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >for which </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >the fair va</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >lue is determinable and measurable. If these </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >conditions are not met, the p</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ayment is classified as</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > c</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ontra-revenue</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > with the related</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > revenue</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > transaction</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > (e.g., Di</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >scount revenue or </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Other</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > revenue</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >)</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > and recorded when incurred</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:0pt;' >Interest Income </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Interest on Card Member loans is assessed using the average dail</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >y balance method. Unless the loan is classified as non-accrual, interest is recognized based upon the principal amount outstanding, in accordance with the terms of the applicable account agreement, until the outstanding balance is paid, or written off. </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >terest and dividends on investment securities primarily relate to our performing fixed-income securities. Interest income is recognized as earned using the effective interest method, which adjusts the yield for security premiums and discounts, fees and oth</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >er payments, so that a constant rate of return is recognized on the investment security&#8217;s outstanding balance. Amounts are recognized until securities are in default or when it becomes likely that future interest payments will not be made as scheduled. </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >terest on deposits with banks and other is recognized as earned, and primarily relates to the placement of cash, in excess of near-term funding requirements, in interest-bearing time deposits, overnight sweep accounts, and other interest-bearing demand and</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > call accounts. </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:0pt;' >Interest Expense </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;' >	</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Interest expense includes interest incurred primarily to fund Card Member loans and receivables, general corporate purposes and liquidity needs, and is recognized as incurred. Interest expense is divided principally into</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > two categories: (i)&#160;deposits, which primarily relates to interest expense on deposits taken from customers and institutions, and (ii)&#160;debt, which primarily relates to interest expense on our long-term debt and short-term borrowings, as well as the realize</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >d impact of derivatives used to hedge interest rate risk on our long-term debt.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:0pt;' >Marketing and Business Development </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >As further described below under &#8220;Recently Adopted Accounting Standards,&#8221; e</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ffective January 1, 2018, in conjunction with the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >adoption of the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >new revenue recognition standard, the</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > previously disclosed</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > &#8220;Marketing and Promotion&#8221; line on the Consolidated Statements of Income was changed to &#8220;Marketing an</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >d Business Development&#8221;</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > to reflect the inclusion of certain </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >reclassified costs fr</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >om Contra-discount revenue and O</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ther expenses. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Marketing and business development provides a more comprehensive view of costs related to building and growing our business, i</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ncluding the reclassified costs</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Marketing and business development expense includ</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >es costs incurred in the development and initial placement of advertising, which are expensed in the year in which the advertising first takes place. Also included in Marketing and business development expense are Card Member statement credits</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > for qualifyi</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ng charges on eligible</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >card accounts, corporate incentive payments earned</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > on achievement of</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > preset</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > targets</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > and </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >certain </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >payments to GNS card issuing partners. These costs are generally expensed as incurred</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:0pt;' >Card Member Rewards</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >We</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > issue</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > charge and credit </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >cards that allow Card Members to participate in various rewards programs (e.g.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > Membership Rewards, cobrand and cash back).  </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Rewards expense is recognized in the period </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Card Members </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >earn rewards, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >generally </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >by spending </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >on their enrolled card products</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > We re</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >cord a Card Member rewards liability that represents the estimated cost of points earned that are expected to be redeemed. Card Member rewards liabilities are impacted over time by enrollment levels, attrition, the volume of points earned and redeemed, and</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > the associated redemption costs. Changes in the Card Member rewards liabilities during the period are taken as a charge or release to the Card Member rewards line.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Effective January 1, 2018, in conjunction with the new revenue recognition standard, Card M</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ember rewards also includes cash-back rewards</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > which were reclassified from contra discount revenue.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:0pt;' >Classification of various items</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:6pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Certain reclassifications of prior period amounts have been made to conform to </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >the current period presentation, including t</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >he </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >reclassification of certain business development expenses from </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Other</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > expenses to Marketing and business development</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > that </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >we</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >re not directly attributable to the adoption of the new</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >revenue recognition guidance.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:6pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;margin-left:0pt;' >Recently Issued Accounting Standards</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In February 2016, the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Financial Accounting Standards Board</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > (FASB) issued new accounting guidance on leases. The guidance, effective January 1, 2019, with early adoption permitted, requires virtually all leases to be recognized on the Consolidated Balance S</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >heets. We will adopt the standard effective January 1, 2019.  </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >The new guidance currently requires a modified retrospective transition approach</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >, which would cause us to record existing operating leases on the Consolidated Balance Sheets upon adoption and in</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > the comparative period. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >In January 2018, the FASB released an exposure draft that, if issued in its current form, would provide us with the option to adopt the provisions of the new guidance prospectively, without adjusting the comparative periods present</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ed.  </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >We are in the process of </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >upgrading our lease administration software and changing</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > business processes and internal controls in preparation for the adoption. Specifically, we are currently reviewing our lease portfolio and are evaluating and interpretin</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >g the requirements under the guidance, including the available accounting policy elections, in order to determine the impacts on our financial position, results of operations and cash flows upon adoption</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >. </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In June 2016, the FASB issued new accounting guida</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >nce for recognition of credit losses on financial instruments, effective January 1, 2020, with early adoption permitted on January 1, 2019. The guidance introduces a new credit reserving model known as the Current Expected Credit Loss (CECL) model, which i</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >s based on expected losses, and differs significantly from the incurred loss approach used today. The CECL model requires measurement of expected credit losses not only based on historical experience and current conditions, but also by including reasonable</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > and supportable forecasts incorporating forward-looking information. In addition, for available-for-sale debt securities, the new guidance replaces the other-than-temporary impairment model, and requires the recognition of an allowance for reductions in a</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > security&#8217;s fair value attributable to declines in credit quality, instead of a direct write-down of the security when a valuation decline is determined to be other-than-temporary. The guidance also requires a cumulative-effect adjustment to retained earni</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ngs as of the beginning of the reporting period of adoption. We do not intend to adopt the new standard early and are currently evaluating the impact the new guidance will have on our financial position, results of operations and cash flows; however, it is</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > expected that the CECL model will alter the assumptions used in estimating credit losses on Card Member loans and receivables, and may result in material increases to our credit reserves as the new guidance involves earlier recognition of expected losses </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >for the life of the assets.  We have established an enterprise-wide, cross-discipline governance structure to implement the new standard, and continue to identify and conclude on key interpretive issues along with evaluating our existing credit loss foreca</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >sting models and processes in relation to the new guidance to determine what modifications may be required.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:6pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In February 2018, as a result of the enactment of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (the Tax Act), the FASB issued new accounting guidance on the reclassification of certain tax effects from </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) (AOCI)</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > to retained earnings</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >. The optional guidance is effective January 1, 2019, with early adoption permitted. We are evaluating whether we will adopt the new guidance along with any impacts on our financial position, results of operations and cash flows, none of which are expected</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > to be material.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:6pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;margin-left:0pt;' >Recently Adopted Accounting Standards</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Effective January 1, 2018, we adopted new revenue recognition guidance issued by the FASB related to contracts with customers. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >The scope of the new guidance excludes financial instruments such as credi</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >t and charge card arrangements. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >We elected to adopt the standard using the full retrospective method, which we believe is most useful to our investors. Under the full retrospective method, we are applying the standard back to January 1, 2016. As shown belo</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >w, the most significant impacts of adoption are changes to the classification of certain revenues and expenses, including certain credit and charge card related costs previously netted against discount revenue, such as Card Member cash-back reward costs an</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >d statement credits, corporate incentive payments, as well as payments to third-party GNS card issuing partners. Under the new revenue standard, these costs are not considered components of the transaction price of our card acceptance agreements with merch</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ants and thus are not netted against discount revenue, but instead are recognized as expenses. Our payments to third-party GNS card issuing partners are presented net of related revenues earned from the partners.  </font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >The impact to the 2017 fiscal quarters a</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >nd years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016 were as follows:</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p></div><p style='line-height:20pt;' /><div><table style='border-collapse:collapse;' ><tr style='height:9pt;' ><td Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' ></font></td><td style='width:11.25pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom;border-color:Black;min-width:11.25pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' ></font></td><td ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' >Three months ended</font></td><td ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' ></font></td></tr><tr style='height:9pt;' ><td colspan='2' rowspan='1' style='width:138.75pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle;border-color:Black;min-width:138.75pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' >930</font></td><td style='width:7.5pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle;border-color:Black;min-width:7.5pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' ></font></td><td style='width:7.5pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle;border-color:Black;min-width:7.5pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' >$</font></td><td style='width:37.5pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle;border-color:Black;min-width:37.5pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' >928</font></td><td style='width:7.5pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle;border-color:Black;min-width:7.5pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' ></font></td><td style='width:7.5pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle;border-color:Black;min-width:7.5pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' >1,026</font></td></tr></table></div><p style='line-height:20pt;' /><div><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:6pt;line-height:13.8pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In addition, the cumulative impact to our retained earnings on January 1, 2016 was</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > an increase of $55.2</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > million. </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >The adoption of the new guidance also resulted in changes to the recognition timing of certain revenues, the impact of which is not material </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >to net income. Similarly, the adoption did not have a</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > material impact on our Consolidated Balance Sheets or Statements of Cash F</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >lows.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > We had no material c</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ontract assets, contract liabilities or deferred contract costs recorded on the Consolidated Balance S</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >heet as of March 31, 2018 and December 31, 2017.  Contracts assets and liabilities are reported in a net position on a contract-by-contract basis at the end of each reporting period.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > In ad</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >opting the guidance, we implemented changes to our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > accounting polici</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >es, business processes, systems and internal controls to support the recognition, measurement and disclosure requirements under the new standard.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > Such changes were not material.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:13.8pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In January 2016, the FASB issued new accounting guidance on the recognition a</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >nd measurement of financial assets and financial liabilities, which was effe</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ctive and adopted</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >by us </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >as of January 1, 2018. The guidance makes targeted changes to GAAP; specifically to the classification and measurement of equity securities, and to certain </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >disclosure requirements associated with the fair value of fin</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ancial assets and liabilities. This applies to investments we make in non-public companies i</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >n the ordinary</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > course of business</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >, which historically were recognized under </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >the cost method of accounti</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ng. These investments</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > will be</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > prospectively adjusted through earnings for observable price changes upon the identification of identical or similar</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > transactions of the same company. The adoption of the guidance </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >did not have a </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >material impact on our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > financial position, result</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >s of operat</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ions and cash flows. We implemented changes to our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > accounting policies, business processes and internal controls in support of the new guidance</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > Such changes were not material. </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In August 2017, the FASB issued new accounting guidance providing t</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >argeted improvements to the accounting for hedging activities, effective January 1, 2019, with early adoption permitted in any interim period or fiscal year </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >before</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > the effective date. The guidance introduces a number of amendments, several of which are opt</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ional, that are designed to simplify the application of hedge accounting, improve financial statement transparency and more closely align hedge accounting with an entity&#8217;s risk management strategies. Effective January 1, 2018, we adopted the guidance, with</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > no material impact on our financial position, results of operations and cash flows, along with associated changes to our accounting policies, business processes and internal controls in support of the new guidance. Such changes were not material. </font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p></div>

<div><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:-19.45pt;' >8</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;' >.  Contingencies</font></p><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In the ordinary</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > course of business, we and our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > subsidiaries are subject to various pending and potential legal actions, arbitration proceedings, claims, investigations, examinations, information gathering requests, subpoenas, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >inquiries and matters relating to compliance with laws and regulations (collectively,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > legal proceedings). We disclose our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > material legal proceedings under Part II, Item 1. &#8220;Legal Proceedings&#8221; in this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q and Part I, Item 3. &#8220;Legal</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > Proceedings&#8221; in the Annual Report.</font></p><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >In addition to the matters disclosed under &#8220;Le</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >gal Proceedings,&#8221; we are</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > being challenged in a n</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >umber of countries regarding our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > application of value-add</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ed taxes (VAT) to certain of our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > international transactions, which ar</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >e in various stages of audit, or are being contested in legal actions (collectively,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > VAT matters). While we believe we have</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > complied with all applicable tax laws, rules and regulations in the relevant jurisdictions, the tax authoritie</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >s may determine that w</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >e owe</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > additional VAT. In certain ju</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >risdictions where we are contesting the assessments, we were</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > required to pay the VAT assessments prior to contesting.</font></p><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > legal proceedings range from cases brought by a single plaintiff to class actions with millions of </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >putative class members. These legal proceedings involve various</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >lines of business</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > and a variety of claims (including, but not limited to, common law tort, contract, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >application of tax laws, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >antitrust and consumer protection claims), some of which present </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >novel factual allegations and/or unique legal theories. While some mat</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ters pending against us</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > specify the damages claimed by the plaintiff or class, many seek an unspecified amount of damages or are at very early stages of the legal process. Even when the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >amount of dam</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ages claimed against us</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > are stated, the claimed amount may be exaggerated and/or unsupported. As a result, some matters have not yet progressed sufficiently through discovery and/or development of important factual information and le</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >gal issues</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > to enable us</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > to estimate an amount of loss or a range of possible loss, while other matters have progressed suffi</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ciently such that we are</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > able to estimate an amount of loss or a range of possible loss.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >We have</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > reco</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >rded reserves for certain of our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > outstan</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ding legal proceedings. A reserve is recorded when it is both (a) probable that a loss has occurred and (b) the amount of loss can be reasonably estimated. There may be instances in which an exposure to loss exceeds t</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >he recorded reserve. We evaluate</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >, on a </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >quarterly basis, developments in legal proceedings that could cause an increase or decrease in the amount of the reserve that has been previously recorded, or a revision to the disclosed estimated range of possible losses, as applicable.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >For those</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > disclosed material legal proceedings and VAT matters where a loss is reasonably possible in future periods, whether in excess of a related reserve for legal or tax contingencies or where there is no such reser</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ve, and for which we are</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > able to estimate a ra</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >nge of possible loss, the current estimated range is </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >zero</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > to $</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >420</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > million in excess of any reserves related to those matters. This range represents management&#8217;s estimate based on currently available information and </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >does not represent our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > maximum l</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >oss exposure; actual results may vary significantly. As such legal</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > proceedings evolve, we may need to increase our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > range of possible loss or reserves.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Based on our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > current knowledge, a</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >nd taking into consideration our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > litigation-</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >related liabilities, we bel</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >ieve we are</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > no</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >t a party to, nor are any of our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > properties the subject of, any legal proceeding that would have a material</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > adverse effect on our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > consolidated financial condition or liquidity. However, in light of the uncertainties involved in such matters, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >it is possible that the outcome of legal proceedings, including the possible resolution of merchant claims, could have a </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >material impact on our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > results of operations.</font></p></div>

<div><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:6pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >The follo</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >wing table presents Card Member loans evaluated individually and collectively for impairment and related reserves as of </font><font >2018</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > and December 31, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >2017</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >:</font></p></div><p style='line-height:20pt;' /><div><table style='border-collapse:collapse;' ><tr style='height:13.5pt;' ><td Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >We have</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > certain assets that are subject to measurement at fair value on a nonrecurring basis. For these assets, measurement at fair value in periods subsequent to their </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >initial recognition is applicable if </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >they are </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >determined to be impaired</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >. During the three months ended March 31, 2018 and the year ended December 31, 2017, we did not have any material assets that were measured at fair value due to impairment. Equity inves</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >tments previously held at cost that are </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >adjusted through earnings for observable price changes are not material.</font></p></div>

<div><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:-20.15pt;' >16</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;' >. style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > investments</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > previously carried at cost</font><font For both periods, other expense also includes </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >general operating expenses, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >Card and merchant-related fraud losses, communication expenses, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >foreign cu</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >rrency-related gains and losses</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > and</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > insurance costs. </font></p></div>

<div><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:-20.15pt;' >14</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;' >.  Income Taxes</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >The effective tax rate was </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >21.5</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > percent and </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >32.0</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > percent for the three months ended </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >March 31</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >2018</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > and </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >2017</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >, respectively</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >The change in tax rates </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >primarily reflect</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >s</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > the</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > reduction in the U.S. federal statutory tax rate as a result of the Tax Act.  T</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >he tax rates in both periods </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >also </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >reflect the resolution of certain prior years&#8217; tax items.  </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >In 2017, we recorded an estimated net discrete tax charge of $2.6 billion related t</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >o the Tax Act that was accounted for as a provisional charge under SAB 118. There were no material changes to these estimates for the current period.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >  We continue to analyze the impacts of the Tax Act</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >;</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > therefore, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >the 2017 charge</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > continues to be provisional</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >We are</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > under continuous examination by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) and tax authorities in other countries and</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > states in which we have</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > significant business operations. The tax years under examination and open for examination vary by jurisdiction.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >The resolution of such matters did not have a material impact on </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >our effective tax rate. We are currently under examination with the IRS for tax years 2008 through 2014.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:9pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >We believe</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > it</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > is reasonably possible that our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > unrecognized tax benefits could decrease</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > within the next 12&#160;months by as much as </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >$</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >319</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >million</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > principally as a result of potential resolutions of prior years&#8217; tax items with various taxing authorities. The prior years&#8217; tax items include unrecognized</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > tax benefits relating to the deductibility of certain expenses or losses and the attribution of taxable income to a particular jurisdiction or jurisdictions.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Of the $</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >319</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > million of unrecognized tax benefits, approximately $291 million relates to amou</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >nts that, if recognized, would impact the effective tax rate in a future period.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > </font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p></div>

<div><p style='text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:-14.4pt;' >5.  Investment Securities</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Investment securities principally include </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >available-for-sale </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >debt securities</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > carried</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > at fair value on the Consolidated Balance Sheets, with unrealize</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >d gains and losses recorded in AOCI</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >, net of income taxes. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >Realized gains and losses are recognized upon disposition of </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >securities using the specific identification method. </font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >Investment securities also include equity securities carried at fair value on the Consolidated Balance Sheets</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' >. Effective January 1, 2018,</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > unrealized gains and losses are recorded in the Consolidated Statements of Income; prior to January 1, 2018, unrealized gains and losses</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;' > were recorded in AOCI, net of income taxes.</font></p><p style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >available-for-sale debt </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >securities in gross unrealized loss positions</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >, (i)&#160;we do</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > no</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >t intend to sell >ikely than not that we </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >will not be </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >required to sell the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >securities before recovery of the unrealiz</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > that the contractual principal and interest wi</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >ll be received on the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >secu</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >rities. As a result, we</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > recognized no other-than-temporary impairment during the periods presented. </font></p><p style='width:3.75pt;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:2;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom;border-color:Black;min-width:3.75pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;' >$</font></td><td Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' >1.35</font></td></tr></table></div><p style='line-height:20pt;' /><div><ul style='margin-top:0pt;' ><li style='list-style:lower-alpha;text-align:left;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:2pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >Our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > unvested restricted stock awards, which include the right to receive non-forfeitable dividends or dividend equivalents, are considered participating securities. Calculations of EPS under the two-class method exclude from the numerator</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > any dividends paid or owed on participating securities and any undistributed earnings considered to be attributable to participating securities. The related participating securities are similarly excluded from the denominator. </font></li><li style='list-style:lower-alpha;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >The dilutive effect of unex</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >ercised stock options excludes from the computation of EPS </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >0.6</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > million and </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >1.2</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > million of options for the </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >three months ended</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >March 31</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >2018</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > and </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >2017</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >, respectively, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >because inclusion of the options would have been anti-dilutive</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >. </font></li></ul><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p></div>

Regular;font-size:7pt;color:#000000;' >16,982</font></td></tr></table></div><p style='line-height:20pt;' /><div><ul style='margin-top:0pt;' ><li style='list-style:lower-alpha;text-align:left;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:2pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >For </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >Global Corporate Payments (</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >GCP</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >)</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > Card Member loans and receivables in </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >Global Commercial Services (</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >GCS</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >)</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >, delinquency data is tracked based on days past billing status rather than days past due.</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > A Card Member account is considered 90 days past billing if payment has not been received within 90 days of the Card Member&#8217;s billing statement d</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >ate. In addition, if we initiate</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' > collection procedures on an account prior to the account becoming 90 days pas</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >t billing, the associated Card Member loan and receivable balance is classified as 90 days past billing. These amounts are shown above as 90+ Days Past Due for presentation purposes. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >See also (b).</font></li><li style='list-style:lower-alpha;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >Delinquency data for periods other than 90 days past billin</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:7pt;' >g is not available due to system constraints. Therefore, such data has not been utilized for risk management purposes. The balances that are current to 89 days past due can be derived as the difference between the Total and the 90+ Days Past Due balances. </font></li></ul><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p></div>
494000000
<div><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:6pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin-left:-15.85pt;color:#000000;' >9</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;' >.   Derivatives and Hedging Activities</font></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;color:#000000;' >We use</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > derivative financial instruments (derivatives) to manage exposures to various market risks. These instruments derive their value from an underlying variable or multiple variables, including </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >interest rates, foreign exchange rates, and equity index or price, and are carried at fair value on the Consolidated Balance Sheets. </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >These instruments enable end users to increase, reduce or alter exposure to various market risks and, for that reason, are </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >an int</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >egral component of our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > market r</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >isk management. We do</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > not transact in derivatives for trading purposes. </font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;color:#000000;' >In relation to our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > credit risk, under the terms</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > of the derivative agreements we have with our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > various counterpartie</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >s, we are</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > not required to eithe</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >r immediately settle any outstanding liability balances or post collateral upon the occurrence of a specified credit </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >risk-related event. Based on our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > assessment of </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >the credit risk of our</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > derivative counterparties as of </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >March 31</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >2018</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > and December 31, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >2017</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >, no credit risk adjustment</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' > to the derivative portfolio was required.</font></p><p style='text-align:left;line-height:12pt;' ></p><p style='text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:12pt;' ><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;margin-left:0pt;' >The following table summarizes the total fair value, excluding interest accruals, of derivative assets and liabilities as of </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >March 31</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >, </font><font style='font-family:BentonSans Regular;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;' >2018</font><font style='font-family:BentonSans modification.
